title: HttpMethod​
content: </> type HttpMethod = "GET" | "POST" | "PUT" | "DELETE" | "HEAD" | "OPTIONS" | "PATCH"

title: HttpHandler​
content: </> type HttpHandler = (request: Request) → string | Response

title: Request​
content: </> interface Request { path: string query: {[string]: string?} method: HttpMethod headers: {[string]: string} body: (string | buffer) }

title: Response​
content: </> interface Response { status: number? headers: {[string]: string}? body: (string | buffer)? }

title: webview​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Window.webview: WebView? This property keeps the attached webview from being garbage collected

title: size​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Window.size: Dimension Does not account for scrollbar in the webview WebView alternative local size: Dimension = window.webview:evaluate("{ x: window.innerWidth, y: window.innerHeight }")

title: close​
content: </> Window:close() → () Closes the window

title: evaluate_noresult​
content: </> WebView:evaluate_noresult(script: string) → () Similar to WebView:evaluate(...), but does not yield and does not return any result Bug(s) Will not work if you run it before calling wry.run()

title: evaluate_callback​
content: </> WebView:evaluate_callback( script: string, callback: (result: unknown) → () ) → () Similar to WebView:evaluate(...), but instead of yielding to return result, it passes the result to the callback function Bug(s) Will not work if you run it before calling wry.run()

title: evaluate​
content: This is a yielding function. When called, it will pause the Lua thread that called the function until a result is ready to be returned, without interrupting other scripts. Yields </> WebView:evaluate(script: string) → unknown Runs the provided javascript code through the webview and returns the last statement as a lua value Bug(s) Will yield forever if you run it before calling wry.run() Will yield forever if you run it while custom protocol is sending response to webview for loading a page Example local result = webview:evaluate([[ let value = { a: 5000 }; value.a += 1000; value ]]) print(result.a) -- 6000

title: ipc_handler​
content: </> WebView:ipc_handler(callback: (message: unknown) → void) → Connection Receive messages from javascript Messages will automatically be converted into luau values Example -- luau webview:ipc_handler(function(message) print(message.print_this) -- "Hello, World!" end) // javascript window.luneweb.postMessage({ print_this: 'Hello, World!' })

title: load_url​
content: </> WebView:load_url(url: string) → () Navigate to the specified url

title: load_url_with_headers​
content: </> WebView:load_url_with_headers( url: string, headers: WebViewHeaders ) → () Navigate to the specified url using the specified headers

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"<parsed-header> has invalid header value."	Occurs when headers contains more than 1 header value

title: Dimension​
content: </> interface Dimension { x: number y: number } 2D Dimension used by Wry for mouse position

title: WebViewHeaders​
content: </> type WebViewHeaders = {[string]: string} Set headers used when loading the requested url

title: create_window​
content: </> Wry.create_window(config: WindowConfig) → Window
interface WindowConfig { title: string? size: Dimension?-- ? default window size represented in physical pixels }  Example local window = Wry.create_window({ title = "Hello, Lune!" })

title: create_webview​
content: </> Wry.create_webview(config: WebViewConfig) → WebView

interface WebViewConfig { with_devtools: boolean? init_script: string? html: string? url: string? headers: WebViewHeaders? custom_protocols: {[string]: HttpHandler}? }  Example Wry.create_webview(window, { html = "<h1>Hello, Lune!</h1>" })

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"<parsed-header> has invalid header value."	Occurs when config.headers contains more than 1 header value

title: event_loop​
content: </> Wry.event_loop( window: Window, callback: (WindowEvent) → () ) → Connection
interface WindowEvent { event_type: string mousebutton: string? keycode: string? pressed: boolean? position: Dimension? }

interface Connection { stop: () → () is_running: () → boolean }  Example local handle handle = Wry.event_loop(window, function(msg) if msg.event_type == "CloseRequested" then window:close() handle.stop() elseif msg.event_type == "KeyCode" then print(msg) elseif msg.event_type == "MouseButton" then print(msg) elseif msg.event_type == "CursorMoved" then print(msg) end end)

title: run​
content: </> Wry.run() → () Runs the main event loop of your application Requirement Must be run when there is atleast one active event loop connection
